III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Approximately two weeks ago, Staff 1 provided two tobacco vapes
to an unknown youth.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 02/06/2025.
No additional information as provided.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 02/06/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Administrator confirmed there
was an incident involving Youth A as he was found to have a vape
pen. He said Youth A refused to disclose who gave him the vape
pen. An incident report was completed and the contraband was
removed.
Manager 1 was interviewed at the facility on 02/06/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Manager 1 reported on
01/18/2025 while on the Pod J, Youth A dropped a vape pen that
was hidden in his pants. She asked Youth A to hand over the
vape pen and he complied without incident. Youth A would not
reveal who or where he got the vape pen. She said Youth A does
not have home passes. An incident report was written and the
vape pen was removed from the pod. Manager 1 denied
witnessing or hearing that Staff 1 provided Youth A with the vape
pen. Manager 1 is not aware of any incidents involving Staff 1
providing youths with any contrabands.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 02/06/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the
facility for 7 months and is placed on Pod J. Youth A admitted he
had a vape pen, but he denied that a staff member provided him
with the vape pen. He said Youth B gave him the vape pen when
they were in the gym. Youth A did not provide the date, but said
he got it from Youth B. Youth A said Youth B did not reveal where
he got the vape pen from. Youth A denied witnessing any staff
member provide Youth B or any other youth with contraband.
2

Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 02/06/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the
facility for 7 months and is placed on Pod J. Youth B denied he
gave Youth A a vape pen. Youth B further denied witnessing a
staff member provide Youth A or any other youth a vape pen.
Youth B had no knowledge of the incident involving Youth A
having a vape.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 02/06/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the
facility for 5 months and is placed on Pod J. Youth C said he
witnessed Youth A and Youth D holding the vape pen. He
believes Staff 1 gave the vape pen to Youth A, because several
weeks ago Youth C saw Youth D write on paper “Pina Colada”
and gave it to Staff 1. Youth C denied witnessing Staff 1 give
Youth D or Youth A a vape pen. Youth C said the only thing he
has seen staff give youths are snacks.
Youth D was interviewed at the facility on 02/06/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth D has been at the
facility for 7 months and is placed on Pod J. Youth D denied
having a vape pen or witnessing any youths with a vape pen.
Youth D denied writing on a paper “Pina Colada” and giving it to
Staff 1. Youth D said his focus is completing the program and
going home. Youth D reported all his needs are being met, and he
feels safe at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 02/06/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a direct care staff,
has been working at the facility for 3 months and completed all
new employee training. Staff 1 confirmed he has worked on Pod J.
Staff 1 denied providing a vape pen to any of youths on Pod J. He
has never witnessed or heard of any staff member providing
youths with a vape pen. He said he heard that a vape pen was
found with Youth A but has no knowledge where Youth A got the
vape pen.
Manager 2 was interviewed at the facility on 02/06/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Manager reported she spoke
with Youth A on 01/18/2025 after Therapist found the vape pen,
and Youth A refused to disclose who gave him the vape pen.
Manger 2 denied any incidents or reports of concerns regarding
Staff 1 providing youths with contraband.
JJ Worker Youth A was interviewed via telephone on 03/12/2025,
in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. JJ Worker confirmed she
3

was notified of the incident involving Youth A having a vape pen.
She said Youth A refused to disclose who gave him the vape pen.
She reported Youth A has been at the facility for 8 months and
has been participating in the program. She expressed no
concerns regarding the facility.
Nurse was interviewed at the facility on 03/19/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Nurse recalls the incident
involving Youth A having a vape pen. She denied witnessing or
hearing that a staff member provided the youth with a vape.
Documents Reviewed:
• Unusual incident report date 01/18/2025 written by
Manager 2. Manger 1 observed Youth A drop a vape pen
on the floor. Manger 1 directed Youth A to hand over the
contraband, Youth A followed the directive. Manager 1
informed Manager 2 of the incident. Youth A did not reveal
how he gained possession of the contraband.
• Youth Handbook states that the possession of contraband
is prohibited. Any unauthorized items in your possession or
in your room will be considered contraband. Contraband
includes any item out of its designated area or any item that
is prohibited to you by program rules or treatment staff.
Your room will be searched by staff on a regular basis.
• Staff 1 has no disciplinary record. Staff 1 completed all new
employee trainings on 11/07/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there is insufficient evidence
to support a rule violation. The youths interviewed denied staff
provided them with the vape. It could not be determined were
youths obtained the vape pen.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
